intro: Vazquezella, commonly known as the Mexican velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Vazquezella is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of conditions. It is sometimes considered a weed due to its invasive tendencies in certain regions.
